reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in Dec, hotel is clean and in a great location for the Arc de Triomphe and metro but, as it is on a side street, it is quiet. Rooms are not massive; you need to ask for one with a bath as the ones with showers are smaller (we did and were moved), but this is standard for 3* Parisien hotels.
reviews.title: Typical 3* Hotel, Good location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is expensive at €12 a head so we walked the 2 minutes to a great 'Paul' boulangerie with seating upstairs in a cosy and atmospheric little room (Ave des Ternes opposite Rue de Montenotte) which cost about a quarter of that.
reviews.title: Loved The Neva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall; good for a 3* and, anyway, who wants to spend time in a hotel room when Paris is outside the front door?
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel Neva from Nov 16th-19th 2007. We were amazed by how central the hotel was to everything, it was in a lovely part right next to the Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysees and 20 min walk from Eifell Tower. The staff at the hotel are so friendly and really go out of their way to help you out. Rooms are clean, comfy and small but hey, its Paris! If anyone ever wants Paris with cheap accom for a base then def recommend this hotel. Right in the centre of everything. Will be returning!
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much searching I finally booked the Hotel Neva for three nights for myself and my partner. The hotel is in a great location, very near to the metro when you first arrive. It is within walking distance of the arc de triomphe and the eiffel tower. We walked to all the other main tourist attractions but this is not reccommended for the old or infirm!
reviews.title: great location, good service and a good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed here,the last time was 6yrs. Ago. Clearly renovations have kept the hotel up to par. Rooms clean and tidy. Excellent location,3 blocks fro Arc de Triumph and metro and RER lines. Thought the rooms were a nice size contrary to other reviews. Staff eager to help and please and english is not a problem. Buffet breakfast good (meat,cheese,eggs,cereal,freshbreads and pastry,juice, yogurt) andcoffee to US standards nice large cups! highly recommend this hotelp
reviews.title: Great hotel,attentive staff,great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel via an easy jet holiday package and chose it due to it's location after staying in montparnasse last time I was in Paris I wanted something more central. The location could not be better, it's just off ave de wagram which is one of the avenues running off the arc de triomphe. It's a 5 min walk from the arc and therefore the same length of time to the metro station, it's a very handy station too as has 5 lines running through it. Also it is a ten min walk if that too the air France bus stop where you can catch the bus direct to both airports, very handy. Anyway back to the hotel, as I said it's on a quiet street so no noise at night, looks a little run down on the outside but is quite typical of many Parisian buildings. Reception area small and clean, reception staff very friendly and spoke good English. I didn't eat breakfast there so can't commen on that, there is a great croissantaire place 2 mins away which sells yummy fresh pastries so we ate there for breakfast, for those who like a bit of home from home there is a mcdonalds and a starbucks a few mins away too.
reviews.title: Good budget base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The lift as with most of these small Parisian hotels is tiny, fit us two and one suitcase in, bu it works and defo beats the stairs if you are on a high floor. We were on 3rd floor in a room overlooking other buildings. I have to say the room is very small, we found no room to move and for the ladies out there, there is no mirror where the one plug is located, made for an interesting getting ready experience. Th bed was a little firm bu I slept well in it so can't complain. Bathroom clean and spacious, shower was hot, no complaints there. Basically in summary this is a perfect hotel if you are looking for a perfect base to explore beautiful Paris, no frills but when you are in such an amazing city who wants to stay inside. Would happily stay again.
reviews.title: Perfect location, excellent value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My english is not very good, but I'm gonna try to write a short review anyway.
reviews.title: Excellent position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My best friend and I went to Paris for some Christmas-shopping in December. We stayed for a long-weekend at hotel Neva. I am very very pleased with the hotel. We stayed in a room with to single beds, and of course a private bathroom. The room was not very big, but not to small either. Perfect for sleeping, maybe a bit small if your plan is to stay in the hotel all day, but who goes to Paris to just stay in a hotel anyway..? The hotel is located in a quiet street, so there were no trafficnoise or other kinds of citynoises. Very quiet although we slept with our balcony door halfway open. A neagative side of the hotel is that we had to sleep with the balcony-door partly open because the humidity in our room was high and the air circulation wasn't particularly good... .
reviews.title: return visitor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Neva on a side trip from the UK. We stayed for three nights. The Hotel was in a fantastic location, bedrooms and bathrooms very clean and although rooms small typical for age and type of building, were very comfortable, and more than covered our needs. We were a party of 6 with three rooms all slightly different, two had bath with shower over, the other a walk in shower which suited our two children as this is what they are used to. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and took great delight in advising places to go and see. We were unsure what to expect for breakfast but as was included in our room rate went for it and was very pleasantly surprised. It was a continental buffet style with enough choice for the fussiest person, cheeses, cold meats, boiled eggs, cereal,yoghurt ,fresh fruit, toast, jam, tea, coffee, drinking chocolate, juice and water. For two people a basket of 6 "bread/pastries/croissants" was place on your table, everything else was serve yourself. sufficent for the heartiest appetite. If you walked away hungry you would have to be very hard to please. Overal fantastic value and would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Five Star Location

likes.liked: — We liked everything, no complaints at all
likes.disliked: — We liked everything, no complaints at all

reviews.title: Génial ! Great !
reviews.text: I went to Paris to the Neva Hotel with my sister and my gran and my mum who is a travel agent and it was absolument génial! Some people have said that the breakfast was a bit too basic and that you were better off going out ... but i disagree. The restaurant is self service and you can get fruit juice, coffee, hot chocolate, cereals, toast, meat, cheese, pain au chocolats... etc etc it's basically a continental breakfast. The staff are very very friendly in the hotel and i managed to improve my french during my stay although they do speak probably every language under the sun. The ones i came across were: Arabic, French, English and Italian. The bar is great for a relaxing chat with friends/family or even the barman and the drinks are around 3euros.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel's situation, it is literally 30 seconds from the metro, the arc de triomphe and the champs-élysées (the long shopping street is what i called it) on foot! Great for the women in particular but there's also things for kids and a huuuuge Virgin Megastore shop which pleased me :D. By the way.. when you come upstairs out of the metro, turn left and cross two roads till you are parallel to the tunnel bit of the arc de triomphe and turn right and go past mcdonalds and one other street and look down left... voila! the neva hotel (down the side street). The hotel staff are more than happy to spend time with you, giving you directions or simply suggesting sites for you to visit. They have a very good knowledge of the city and were a great help to us. Just one more thing.. the restaurant across from l'hôtel is also génial! The woman didn't speak much english but that wasn't a problem as the food was excellent... although it might not suit younger children and there is a lot of meat but also some vegetarian things too.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

likes.disliked: — the double room had no bath

reviews.title: Cosy Hotel
reviews.text: I hope you found this review helpful and inspiring because i was definitely inspired by the Neva Hotel and i want to go back there again as soon as possible!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed here for 2 nights from 17-19th March 2007. We were in Paris for 3 days for a special birthday present.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience, clean and cosy

likes.liked: — Great location and friendly, helpful staff and lovely clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Paris or Europe for that matter. Our flight was delayed by a day due to wind and the Air France bus had to let us off at the Porte Maillot stop instead of the Arc de Triomphe due to a state visit by the PM of Isreal. After the walk we were happy to finally get to the hotel. It was perfect. I can't tell you kow well it is located. We stayed in Paris for 7 days and the proximity to the Metro and RER was wonderful. There are several restaurants, grocery stores, and pharmacies all around. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and spoke English very well though I enjoyed trying out my French a time or two. The room was a little small but the view of the small Rue Brey was great. The sheets are a little on the rough side and the bathtub had a shower nozzle but it was one that you had to hold the entire time you took a shower. I really must recommend the Museum Pass by the way if you plan on sightseeing. The windows are very well sealed against the street noise. I will definately stay here the next time we are in Paris.
reviews.title: Paris Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went for a weekend away and the Neva and was 2 streets off the arch de triomphe, literally turn the corner from the street of the hotel and it was there. So obviously getting around was so easy with the Charles de Gualle metro station being one of the biggest. As to be expected in Paris the rooms were not huge but more than enough for 2 people for a weekend and there is so much to do in the city its only really used as a base. Paris is a great city to go with so much to do and most of the time we just walked around soaking up the atmosphere and being 5 minutes away from the champs-elysees (maybe 10 after navigating all the stop signs around the arch de triomphe!) the hotel was great for this. Also the staff there was so friendly the lady that we spoke to seemed to work all the time we asked her to book us a taxi as we had tickets to the moulin rouge show and as we waited on the night the taxi was a bit late, but she was straight on the phone and even waited outside for the taxi to arrive. Paris is not a cheap city but you could pay a lot more for a lot worse than this hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Neva was in a perfect location less than 5mins walk from the Arc De Triomphe. It's also very close to Charles De Gaulle Etoile metro station, so getting around was really easy. It was great value for money and the room was a fairly reasonable size with very helpful staff. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After reading good reviews on trip advisor, I booked this "budget" hotel through an online travel agent and got a fantastic deal, about $160 Canadian tax included. Triple rooms were also available with three twin beds for about $190 tax incl.
reviews.title: Great Deal! Definitely recommended!

likes.disliked: — garbage truck making noise in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only is this hotel in a great location (steps from metro, supermarket, restaurant, bars, champs elysees), but the staff is also super friendly and the rooms are very clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spotless and quite spacious for Paris.
reviews.title: Ideal Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in a brilliant location, just a few steps from the arc du triumphe and about a 15 min walk from the Eiffel tower. Rooms are small but they are en-suite, have a television, some storage and a mini-bar. Staff are friendly and speak a good level of English (much better than my French). They are keen to offer the best possible service to their customers and even recommended TV programmes we may be interested in! Only negative was that the room was very hot as we could not get our air conditioning to work! Having said that, I'm sure that if we had actually mentioned this to the staff it would have been sorted very quickly!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel in Paris, nice size rooms, good food, clean..location to die for(just around the corner from the Champs elysees)
reviews.title: Fantastic value in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great value for money.
reviews.title: clean comfortable friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have sent around 8 people to this hotel..all have come back thrilled with their experience.
reviews.title: Quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.title: Not what it used to be....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through 'Skoosh' and got a reasonable deal including breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Location, Gloomy Room

likes.disliked: — Tired, in need of re furbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location, walking distance of Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe, close to shops cafe's & restaurants. Metro short five minute stroll which means all of Paris can be reached quite easily. Eiffel Tower approx 20 mins walk, but you can quite easily get there by Metro.
reviews.title: Comfortable friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast self service from small breakfast bar, but was replenished and fresh, and adequate to set you up for the morning. Hot drinks, pastries and bread were servied to you upon upon seating.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English, happy to advise on restaurants in the area, and the small bar at the hotel was good value, so have a drink here before venturing out for the evening.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience- Dirty, Unsafe, Poor MGMT- STAY AWAY

likes.disliked: — Everything: Guestroom, Cleanliness, Staff, Senior Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room overlooked quiet side street, with few nice restaurants. Bedding and towels clean, bed and pillows did the job, bathroom had bath with overhead shower and plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: Disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: Small hotel with small rooms some better than others .. some have seperate toilet and bathroom .. which can be very smelly and noisy .. Staff very friendly and helpful .. breakfast staff haven't got a clue .. value for money only because of location and staff
reviews.title: Hotel near Champs Elysee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel has good locatoin next to Arc de Triumf. But rooms are very small. Breakfast is too simple, but price is almost like real 4 stars hotel. During this trip I has changed 2 hotel, another one was same rate, also good location but twice comfortable.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Neva Hotel for 3 nights in June 2011. The main advantage of the hotel is its closeness to the Arc de Triomphe, the Metro, the Air France Airport bus station. Its location in a small side street provides enough quietness for a good sleep. The rooms are spacious (compared to the Paris standard for small hotels) but make an aged impression. However you find everything you need, including free WiFi internet access. Breakfast is simple, but copious. The staff is very friendly and helpful: The made everything possible to give us a twin bed room, as we requested, although the hotel was full. All in all a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Simple, but very pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This wasn't our first choice of hotel, but have to say it turned out to be really good. Perfect location, friendly staff, clean rooms and good breakfast. The staff at the reception were very helpful and happy to assist us when we had any queries. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any one going to Paris for the first time because of it's central location.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Located on a quiet street, 20-30 min walk to the Eiffel Tower, 2 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and right near the metro station. We used the metro to get to most places. I'd stay at this hotel if you are looking to find a decent price hotel that you are not planning on spending any time in. The rooms are very small, bathroom is a decent size. Worked for what we were looking for, but if you are looking to stay at a comfortable, nice size hotel, this is not the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Mediocre Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the Hotel Neva is a lovely hotel in a great location, we had some problems with them.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but we were taken advantage of...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my husband and I went to check in they told us, "Your room has a problem, there is no air conditioning and a problem in the bathroom. We will move you to our sister hotel for your comfort." I was really angry and felt like we were being scammed. We asked for another room (fully booked), a refund (not possible...), to be moved to another hotel in the area (all full). We ended up going to their sister hotel (Hotel Cheverny http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g187147-d197512-Reviews-Cheverny-Paris_Ile_de_France.html). This hotel was not as convenient and not as nice. It also didn't have air conditioning AT ALL. Our travel agent called the Neva and was told that they had a large group check in the day before our arrival that was larger than expected, so they got our room. Not acceptable since we had already paid, had booked a few months ago, etc.
reviews.title: excellent hotel... value for money.... excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ended up moving back to the Neva after two nights at Cheverny and our booking agency refunded one of our nights. While the booking agency ended up doing the right thing in the end, I was very disappointed with the whole experience.
reviews.title: Very good location, decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: situated close to Arc de Triomphe ......... an excellent hotel value for money.... breakfast spread was good...the location offers a variety of options for food lovers .... the metro station is closeby take a 2 day pass and travel around paris as many times as you want.... friendly staff, clean rooms. will definitely stay when i visit the next time....
reviews.title: Excellent location poor Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked this hotel using its own website when I found that virtually every other hotel in Paris was full (partly due to the Paris Airshow being on at the time I wanted to go), and found it by Googling. An excellent location in a fairly quiet street (there are a few restaurants and a night club further down the street so inevitably there are people about at night) just five minutes walk from Etoile Metro or the Air France buses to/from Charles de Gaulle. Lots of shops, cafes etc in the area - we did not fancy paying the hotels price for breakfast but found five or six perfectly good alternatives within minutes of the hotel. The rooms (we had two twins) were quite a good size for central Paris, clean and everything worked. While nothing to write home about, the hotel is perfectly good for a short stay at the price and we had no real complaints. But equally it is pretty ordinary in terms of facilities and quality; our cleaners forgot to enter our room on one of the days; and when I sought some help regarding a quick internet search to confirm which airport terminal I needed to go to when leaving, the hotel desk was more interested in selling a taxi service to me - so overall an "Average" rather than "Good". But I have stayed in much worse and would recommend Neva as a good mid-budget hotel for Paris trips.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT LOCATION, STAFF VERY FRIENDLY, HOTEL QUITE SMALL
